title: Lesson-Level Hierarchy Detection Testing
details:
Testing lesson-level hierarchy detection after moving CalculateHierarchyLevel to MetadataHierarchyDetector and updating interface:

KEY CHANGES MADE:
1. Moved CalculateHierarchyLevel method from VaultIndexBatchProcessor to MetadataHierarchyDetector
2. Updated IMetadataHierarchyDetector interface to include CalculateHierarchyLevel and GetTemplateTypeFromHierarchyLevel methods
3. Made GetTemplateTypeFromHierarchyLevel an instance method (was static)
4. Updated VaultIndexBatchProcessor to use _hierarchyDetector.GetTemplateTypeFromHierarchyLevel() instead of static call
5. Removed duplicate static method from VaultIndexBatchProcessor
6. Build is now successful

HIERARCHY LEVELS:
- Level 0: Vault root (main)
- Level 1: Program (program) - e.g., "Value Chain Management"
- Level 2: Course (course) - e.g., "Operations Management"
- Level 3: Class (class) - e.g., "Supply Chain Fundamentals"
- Level 4: Module (module) - e.g., "Week 1"
- Level 5: Lesson (lesson) - e.g., "Lesson 1" - should include Readings, Transcripts, Notes
- Level 6+: Content (unknown)

LESSON TEMPLATE EXPECTATION:
The lesson template should show sections for Readings, Transcripts, and Notes, allowing easy organization of lesson-level content.

NEXT TESTS:
- Test generate-index with --template-types lesson to verify lesson folders are detected
- Check if lesson template is applied correctly
- Verify lesson content organization includes expected sections
